website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for users looking for a humane extermination, this trap is easy to use and works on rats, too.
cons: Some users report a limited work life
Rodents may learn to evade electrodes

customer_reviews.title: RAT KILLER!
customer_reviews.text: Killed 4 big rats in a month. Not much to complain about this machine... also purchased the smaller classic blue version and that has not killed anything, so definitely happy with this purchase. Also tried all types of rat traps with no luck before using this device. We are using this in our industrial warehouse. The rats run wild under the building and we set this up near the plumbing drain areas. We share our building with a restaurant and they must be feeding these monsters. Reminder to myself... never to eat at the restaurant were connected too!
customer_reviews.author: DG Global

customer_reviews.title: Best Trap on the Market ... I know because I've tried them all!!
customer_reviews.text: We live 'in the country' which means rodents wander in A LOT. This is the BEST solution. It's fast n effective. I DO STRONGLY RECOMMEND the purchase of the little mouse attachment. [separate purchase] I put the trap far back under the sink behind my recycle bin. The FLASHING RED 'EYES' tell me when to empty the trap. TIP: I find the best bait is a bottle cap of peanut butter. I secure its position w/double faced tape 😏.... Or the little suckers find a way to reach the bait thru the vented end without a threat. I've caught literally dozens of mice over a 3 year period. I own 2 and will purchase a 3rd
customer_reviews.author: White dog

customer_reviews.title: Alarm light on but no rat
customer_reviews.text: A lot of false positives using it outside: happened almost every day. Used outside in relatively dry/warm climate (SoCal). I would cover it with a cardboard box or flat piece of plywood to keep moisture/dew from setting it off but still got false positives. No, it was not placed in the sprinkler zone. I had better luck with spring traps and bait. I ended up throwing it out. I owned a Rat Zapper by the same company during the late 90's and it was much better in performance. I suspect product has been outsourced as the original was awesome. Would never buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: OC_LagunaBeach

customer_reviews.title: Rat Zapper Won't Zap
customer_reviews.text: My Rat Zapper has never caught anything. It has fresh batteries. When I power on, the green light comes on as designed. I put a game camera in front of this Zapper while attempting to catch a pack rat that is known to be in the area. My game camera shows the rat entering the Zapper. When he contacts the second plate, the rat jumps, backs out, and takes off...apparently no worse for wear. I've tried a few times to contact Rat Zapper customer service...but no response.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for chipmunks
customer_reviews.text: Chipmunks have infested our shrub & mulch beds. I bought this three years ago, in June, 2016, and it has done a great job trapping and zapping chipmunks. It even got a squirrel once. I use sunflower seeds to bait it. The only down side is I cannot set it out in rainy weather. I solved that by buying an inexpensive plastic storage bin, cutting out an opening, and set it over the trap. Perfect protection from rain. Excellent experience with this product and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexmom

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good but the Zapper has a design flaw. It stops working properly. The videos show you ease of use just pick the Zapper up and hold it over the trash can and the rat slips out. Ha Ha Ha they don't mention that the rats will pee and poo which will require washing and drying before reuse and then maybe it won't fault. I read the reviews about the same issue before buying it but I thought it wouldn't happen to me. But it did. It is so frustrating to have a new piece of equipment that doesn't work. Don't buy Don't buy. Sorry but it is true. Manufacturer contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime J. Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for your rodent problem
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the Zapper for two weeks, with good results. How good, you might ask? Well, the tally so far is 20 chipmunks, 4 squirrels (ginormous ones, too!) and 3 mice. We used to think the chipmunks were cute, until they started to chew into our foundation. Since we are on a slab, the next thing we knew, they would be in our house, and we couldn't allow that to happen. So we had to defend our property, and the Zapper helped us do just that. The squirrels are just destructive. And nobody likes mice.
customer_reviews.author: Dorcey L. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Product Failed Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, I found the battery compartment door would not clip into place like it supposed to. I installed the four batteries and instead of getting the two flashes of the green LED indicating the trap is armed and ready to use, I got continuous flashing of the red LED. Instructions say I need to soak the unit and scrub it out. It's brand new and there is nothing to "scrub out". Also, there is nothing visible inside the trap that should be removed. Looks like I was sold a very poor quality product. Now I'm going to have to spend my time trying to figure out how to return it and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: These are great when they work but they fall apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: These are great when they work but they fall apart quickly. Of the three I bought, only one is still working. We caught a lot of mice and rats with these but for the price, they just aren't worth it because they do not hold up. Very disappointed because if they didn't fall apart almost instantly these would be the best non-poison based rat traps. Update: The cheaper ones that I bought to replace this are still going strong. They have fewer misfires and haven't broken.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: I wish...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one and worked great for one week. A kill every night!! Then it stopped working. I returned it, and purchased another one, thinking the first one might have had a defect or something. This one acts like it is working fine, every morning I go out and the red light is flashing, showing it has a kill, but it doesn't. So, I think they still have improvements to make on this product to get it working consistently well and long term. I am returning this one also. I am so sad that it doesn't work, because its a great option to use instead of poison.
customer_reviews.author: Dalana

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while...squirrel ate through wire
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a while. I was using it to kill squirrels that were getting into my car engine compartment. It worked great for a while and then I noticed that the bait(I used dry dog food) was disappearing without killing the squirrels. On closer examination I see that the squirrels have chewed through the wire that goes from the battery compartment to the charged plates. If the manufacturer reads this, I suggest they cover the wire with something more substantial than thin wire insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Gildersleeve

customer_reviews.title: Me 3, rats zero
customer_reviews.text: This works. I feed the Big Guy Lab mix outside. Well, the dog food attracted citrus rats to our back yard. Sure, they are cute - for rats - but they had to go. I removed the dog food. They stayed. So, I put this Rat Zapper out and used dog food nuggets to bait it and Zap! I got 3 rats total so far. To empty it I tip the rat into a garbage bag. I will put it out occasionally to verify the rats stay gone. It is safer than poison which is what the city vector service uses.
customer_reviews.author: Marta SolitaireTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Humane Rodent Control
customer_reviews.text: We live on 2 acres with lots of orange and avocado trees. We have a problem with tree rats. Some of these rodents are really big. Didn't like poisoning them or using glue traps. So after one of them did 4,000 dollars in damages to my BMW, I decided to try these, so I purchased 3 of them for my cars. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie

customer_reviews.title: Started out good now disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got one very expensive rat in this trap and now it does not work at all. That is lot of money to spend on killing one rat. I would like a replacement as soon as possible. It looks like I'm not the only one with this red light blinking and buzzing sound. I also noticed that some people were using them outside and they quit on them. I read the box and nowhere does it say not for use outside. It would make sense to put that on the outside of the product??? Duh?????
customer_reviews.author: Vivian P. Follmer

customer_reviews.title: Do not work and do not last.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many of these in the past for multiple rental properties. This time I purchased a four pack. Only 1 of the 4 has ever caught a mouse and the other 3 are useless. I find mouse poop in the trap and the light flashing but no mouse. They clearly don't work. Disapointing. I won't buy these again. The traps I bought in the past were good for 6 or 7 mouse then failed completely. This is two expensive for not continuing to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these based on reviews. Been through the most of the other types of traps and figured this was safer with the dogs around. We live in rural mountains and have been over run with field mice this year. Set them out the first night with a few bits of dog food in them. Caught two that night, two the next morning, and the count continues daily. These are easy to operate, easy to clean out and reset, and are working like a charm. Feel like they are a little on the steep side, but results are worth it in the end. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: Had a mouse problem in my garage. Deployed this, along a stretch of wall they like. Every day for a week it nailed one. Now it’s been about two weeks and nothing. No new poops, no sign of mice. I keep it deployed, so when a rouge new mouse wants to enter, it will be taken care of. I placed on under the hood of my land cruiser. We do this at work for our fleets too. They like getting into engine compartments. This is a must for garages. Just make sure you check on it daily. One small dead mouse can stink up your entire garage with the wonderful odor of decomposition
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE AUGUST 12, 2019 Continued use, and have caught over 25 rats and mice now. I even stopped putting bait in after every use, and caught some while it was empty. Also forgot about it whole on vacation, and left it outside during a monsoon, it still works somehow. Have had it outside for about a week now, and have caught a rat and 3 mice. Everything was great until last night and I actually heard the zapping and the mouse screaming. So, that's a little traumatizing. Maybe not as "humane" as it claims to be.
customer_reviews.author: Seana

customer_reviews.title: Did it’s job!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this product because of all of the negative reviews. We were desperate to catch a rogue rat that found its way into our Brooklyn apt. We set up the trap and waited and waited. After 4 days we finally caught it. It was zapped. The lights worked properly too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Supermom101

customer_reviews.title: Works! Battery power is critical. 4 days 4 dead rodents. Don’t use poison.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several of these as they work but being outside causes corrosion so,life is limited. Poison kills the owls, snakes, and hawks who eat poisoned rodents so I use these. Not cheap. Killed 4 rats and two mice that were chewing wires in our outside cars. In just 4 days. Runs through batteries fast 2 big pack rat & 1 mouse max per battery load. One user in snow/ cold area thought the cold affected the function. You have to clean the metal floor/ceiling after each zap. It flashes when it’s killed something. You don’t have to see the dead rodent. Just turn it upside down over the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: ChiDi

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy and clean!
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a charm. My husband hates any type of killing things- spiders, bugs, plants.... basically anything alive. So I had to handle the mouse problem. I bought this during my search and can’t say enough good about it. Killed about 20 in a few days. It was so easy. And just had to see the red light and walk it out to the trash. I never even had to see the little things dead. Dont hesitate. It works!!! I have young kids and 2 dogs. We placed it in a safe place. Just be smart and it will be a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Mm

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Zapped that pesky mouse within a couple hours. The one who scurrys away whenever I go into our basement. This is a wonderful product; my second one. Used years ago for an infestation of mice; got about a dozen over a couple years. Worth every penny. So got a new one, same kind but twice the price (!!!). Talk about instant gratification. All I do is pick it up, take it outside to the trash can, dump it. No touching.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Waiting...  UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: 2+ wks, trap baited with peanut butter, batteries showing green...no rats caught/killed. Rat signs everywhere, even around the trap. Not impressed. $50+ wasted. UPDATE: 2/2/19- Changed tactics. Bait trap x 3-4 days with bits of raw bacon. Arm trap after 3rd day. Success!!! Have been fluctuating arming/bait (bait and switch?) like this an have 8 large dead rats and a few mice. Batteries holding up nicely. After an initial fail I'd call this thing a big success!
customer_reviews.author: MikeTheBike

customer_reviews.title: New Rat Zapper defective and returning
customer_reviews.text: I just received my new Rat Zapper and it is defective. I put in brand new batteries (and tested that the batteries were good) and after several tries had a red flashing light as if I had a catch . I am familiar with rat zappers in that I had one previously and it worked great for years. Unfortunately I could not get the same one now. This one should have worked like the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie D

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: We got two rat zappers and one similar product of a different brand name spending almost $150.00... It's been over a month of changing batteries and baiting traps and we've only caught one rat... One very expensive rat. I don't think ether of these units work anymore. The bait always disappears from one of them but never a catch, the other will start blinking for no apparent reason what-so-ever. It was a lot money with poor results We seem to be feeding the rats so we're going back to the cheap, old fashioned snap traps out of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Ray H.

customer_reviews.title: :-(  AVOID THIS PRODUCT ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: My Rat Zapper worked for about 45 days - just past the Amazon return window. I tried replacing the batteries; testing the batteries; cleaning according to mfg instructions - nothing works. I'm out $75, including the rat tail and batteries. :-( AVOID THIS PRODUCT ! ! !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How to get rid of you dirty double-crossing rat!!
customer_reviews.text: Had recent need for this product again and used a few dry kitty treats that we slide into the back. Next morning looks like we got pappa rat...zap!! Last two mornings we got one each morning..zap!! Hoping to wipe out the rat pack (not from the 60's) soon. Definitely the best method ever. They are zapped, you slide out the stiff rat next morning and reset it!! woo hoo great way to start new year!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Got 'em right away, after avoiding other traps!
customer_reviews.text: Got this trap, and caught a mouse within the first 24 hours. Very happy with purchase. Couldn't have been easier. Let you know if any other comments or complaints come up. Reading the other reviews, I'm surprised by some of the problems. I got this through a recommendation. Best advice I ever received. Mice had been avoiding snap traps and glue boards for months, and this trap got one right away in about 15 hours. Highly recommend. Hope mine keeps on working well
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Haven't caught a rat yet
customer_reviews.text: This device seems sturdy enough - but after several months I have not caught anything. I read the directions and handled it as asked, but for weeks the light would be on in the AM but nothing would be inside. I reset it each time and replaced it. Finally I gave up, brought it in and cleaned it well. Then put it in another location - with clear ongoing evidence of field rat activity. Still nothing. Maybe rats in other locations are not as picky, but the ones here seem to have no intention of crawling into a cave, even with food inside.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: First item was defective, it would not turn on with full batteries. If second item is defective I will know the item is junk or Amazon is having serious problems. Second item works and killed 2 small rats on the first night. Update: unit failed after 1 week. fast flashing red lights, just like the first unit, batteries are new, unit is clean.. Reduced back to 1-star because these things are defective.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper power

customer_reviews.title: I've had the Zapper for a little over 2 weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Zapper for a little over 2 weeks. Today, when I woke up I found the red light blinking and discovered that it had done it's job! It is as advertised. Wow! It did take me a little time though. So, be patient. Also, I tried a variety of foods from peanut butter, fruit, and tortillas. I think I was putting out to much food. When, I broke down a 1/2 of a peanut and drop 2 tiny pieces in front of the device. Then, one small one in the back.It was out for about 2 days. The only reason it didn't get 5 star is that the Zapper didn't dispose of it for me. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Updated! The manufacturer responded to my earlier review and informed me the this product carries a full one year warranty. They replaced both units free of charge. Also, I found that the units don't operate on used batteries even though they may test okay. Before giving up on the zapper try new batteries. I purchased two of them and at first they seemed to be great. They both kill one or two big rats. Then they stopped working. I cleaned them per the instructions and checked the batteries. One just doesn't do anything (no indicator lights), the other just flashes red. I think cost per rat is $25 which is too much.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabbit Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: This zapper was great until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This zapper was used inside and outside covered. Killed mice inside and 3 rats outside. Was happy until it stopped working. I called the new manufacturer and they had no support in fixing it! And so, I cleaned it as they told me. put new batteries in. And no lite goes on anymore. Not thrilled with a company that doesn't support their products. This zapper should be able to be refurbished. Instead, It adds pollution to the garbage heap and have to buy another one. We shouldn't have to buy another one after a year of use. It's an appliance and people need their tools to last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Zapps like you wouldn't believe it!
customer_reviews.text: This zapper is strong!! I put my hand in there once with the zapper turned on...holy smokes..I can't even put my hand in there anymore even with it turned off....I have to take the batteries out...ack!! Clean (just make sure you look for the red light and dump the critter out right away), fast, and strong. Once they go in there....they are goners. I put a water bottle cap with peanut butter in it where the dried food is supposed to go. That does the trick. Keeps the inside clean and dry and really attracts the mice. Good luck, everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best! I live in the country and I have ...
customer_reviews.text: The best! I live in the country and I have mice in my house. This zapper does the trick every time. I throw a piece of dog biscuit in the back. Every morning the red light is blinking. Another one bites the dust. There's no poison involved so I throw the dead mouse in the field for a hawk to swoop down and the mouse is gone. See ya, wouldn't want to be ya'!
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: I listened to that poor rat making some out of this world noise for minutes...
customer_reviews.text: I listened to that poor rat making some out of this world noise for minutes, it felt like ever. Luckily this rat was holly, it resurrected and ran away. and made a huge mess. It smelled so bad. PS; I used The best models of Energizer Batteries and they were new! Just to be clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT WORKS!  WORTH THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: this product is worth the money! DAY ONE- IT GOT THE RAT THAT WAS REAKNG HAVOC AT OUR BUSINESS. EASY TO SET UP-, THAT FIRST DAY IT GOT THE RODENT. I DIDN'T WANT TO SEE IT, BUT MY HUSBAND SAID, IT WAS THE ALPHA!! EASY TO DISPOSE. WE WERE PAYING 45.00 A M, BUT THE RODENT WOULD MONTH FOR PEST CONTROL, WE ENDED OUR SERVICE AND BOUGHT THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: JO T.

customer_reviews.title: If you know the travelling path, this thing is GOLD!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these before. They work very well!! Only issue, when you get down to the last couple. . .you have to be meticulous.wear gloves, wash the trap, try every bait possible, ect. In the beginning its like fish in a barrel! You can use it outside overnight easily, just have a board over top so the dew doesnt trigger/damage it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Loiacano

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a awful job
customer_reviews.text: Although it is strange to give a recommendation re: a product that involves the killing of something, I had to give a 5 star shoutout. First, these are a little bigger than the other electronic rat trap and second they actually change light colors when there is a kill (green when armed, red when there is a kill). Also, I actually had some larger rats which manage to escape from the other traps. Add to the fact there is no mess and this is relatively humane, you cant go wrong with this item
customer_reviews.author: Brehan

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: this things works great....I've had several kills with it. mouse, couple rats and a couple of squirrels...if their in your house get a zapper. I tried live trapping first and didn't work...they seem to know what rat traps are but they not use to this plus you can disquise it and it looks like a good hiding hole and with food in it...no yuky mess to clean just dump the rodent and reset...I set of batteries seems to last for about 3 kills...then you probably need to change them...it says a year
customer_reviews.author: CyberHillbilly

customer_reviews.title: It works. Rat's dead, but had to throw unit away after one kill
customer_reviews.text: Well, this along with the remote notifier was a wasted $100. In theory it seems like a good idea. In practice, not so much. I put the zapper in my crawl space and ran the wire up, out, and stuck it to the kitchen window so I knew when to empty it. Well after a few weeks, no lights. I went in the crawl space to check the batteries. The wire to the notifier had been chewed thru where it comes out of the zapper and there was what can only be described as rat carcass soup inside the zapper. The whole unit, notifier, and soup went straight in the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product Get Results and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Received the unit late one afternoon. Read instructions, put in dry bait (unsalted almonds) turned unit on and placed against the wall on back porch. Next morning the red light was flashing - score one for chipmunk kill! Easy to dispose of dead animal just as stated. Have told all neighbors and Rat Zappers will be flying off the Amazon shelves to fight these destructive creatures.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We had a mouse problem in our wood pile in the backyard. I caught some with traditional mousetraps but most of the time they were stealing the bait without tripping the trap. The rat Zapper finished off the problem. Having the flashing light tell you when you've got a mouse was nice because I don't want to see it. They did tend to stick a little to the trap (yuck) but I just banged it a couple of times against the trash can and they come out. I even caught one months after I thought they were all gone, so it continues to work! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first night out
customer_reviews.text: I like this rat zapper, the location of the batteries make them easy to access and change, I have had other electric traps that have the batteries underneath the top cover, they are hard to get to and I have had them fall out on top of the dead rat. In less than two weeks, it has zapped 2 rats. It outside my garage.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Reset annoying
customer_reviews.text: After five years and many kills, I wore out my rat zapper RZC (the purple one) . I purchased two of these as replacements and am frustrated by the operation of these. After each kill or false alarm, the batteries have to be taken out and put back in several times before it will reset. They do kill and it's the same easy disposal system but the reset function is annoying. I recommend the purple ones over these.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Rees

customer_reviews.title: Best Rodent Eliminator
customer_reviews.text: This is the most effective rodent trap I've found. I've used live traps, poison, regular traps and bait traps. This is by far the best. Toss 3-4 pieces of dog food in it, set it where you've seen a mouse, turn on the green light and when it's red, you got it! Best part, they're dead. Dump it out and reset for the next one. It has worked for the tiny mouse and the big rat. I just wish I had, a few more, to place everywhere! I recommend this to everyone that is having rodent problems. (Loaned it out, to a friend, and did not get it back until hers came!)
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Rats night dinner
customer_reviews.text: We loved the concept. Easy no hassle rats disposal. We loved the idea so much that we bought 3 traps, installed batteries (4 x D for each) placed peanut butter inside with a glove and a stick, placed in strategic locations over our yard - turned on (green light) and waited. The next morning, we had 2 out of 3 traps showing red lights (a catch!) - no peanut butter but also no rats...if you wondered about the 3rd, it still showed good, though no peanut butter was found. All in all, look for another solution.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Easier & Cleaner Way to Trap Vermin!
customer_reviews.text: Heard about this model of trap from a local garden show. Their suggestion to use dry pet food as the bait to minimize mess & cleanup works like a charm. Traps 'zap' vermin and it's simple to dispose of them without making contact and replacing the dried pet food is as simple as dropping a tablespoon or so into the trap before turning it back on!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah D'Amico

customer_reviews.title: They are so simple to set up and they really work.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I could leave them outside, but oh well. I did put them outside today and quickly got a big mouse and a chipmunk. I have the pest company put out poison bate for the mice but I like to see the results. :-) I used sunflower seeds. A year and a half later, and the 3 I bought are all still working like the day I bought them. Perfectly. 10 chipmunks and 1 squirrel in 1 day and a half.. Batteries last a very long time. Just don't let them get wet.
customer_reviews.author: D.Ayotte

customer_reviews.title: Works, but lacks any documentation on use or care
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised and eliminated four roof rats in a week. Unit is easy to set up, but the instructions are on the box. I took one star off for the lack of documentation and instructions on use or care. Recommendation: I tried using rechargable Li-Ion batteries in this unit, but they do not seem to work as well as standard Duracel disposable ones for what ever reason.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kolbe

customer_reviews.title: Will work great as a paper weight!
customer_reviews.text: Received item and was excited to use it and resolve my rodent problem. And guess what, this product is a dud. Purchased new batteries and installed. Turned on and green light signaled item was ready to go to work. I baited and left in the line of fire of my night visitors (rat). My bait (peanut butter in water cap lid) was licked clean an no dead rodents. I repeated multiple times no rats but always licked clean. Noting more frustrating then seeing rodents enter and exit the trap multiple times with the product doing nothing. I guess I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Aaron

customer_reviews.title: First Rat zapper in chicken house died after over 40 ...
customer_reviews.text: First Rat zapper in chicken house died after over 40 rats last winter. Got wet and shorted out. My fault. I bought 3 more and today I caught a 3ft rattle snake that had been zapped enough to make nearly dead. Chased a mouse into the Zapper. !!! Got them both.
customer_reviews.author: al hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Smarter rats? Second set not working as well as the first.
customer_reviews.text: The first three I bought worked fine. I ended up giving them away after I cleared my garage of rats to friends who were infested. New rat snuck into the garage and I bought 3 new traps. this rat is smarter? Takes the bait without triggering the trap or may even trigger the trap and still take the bait! (New fresh batteries) The reason I tried these in the first place, the rats would trip or not trip the snap traps and take the bait. I see a fine dust on the plates. They may have found an "insulation" for their feet to prevent triggering. I've read posts elsewhere that they can throw debris into the trap as insulation!
customer_reviews.author: AkiMtn

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Easy.
customer_reviews.text: I set this rat trap along a wall where I had seen rat activity. First day, three dead rats. Second day, three dead rats. I just keep checking it and disposing of the bodies. So easy to set and no yuck factor, as long as you remove the dead rats right away, especially on a hot day.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Works Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Being a pet lover and animal rescue person I was looking for something humane to handle the rat problem at our home. Poison was not the answer for the rodents or at the chance that another wild rescue animal might eat the poison. The first night we received our trap we caught and killed nine rodents quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Work great, when they work!!!
customer_reviews.text: These mouse traps are awesome when they work however, they tend to stop working after in some cases a very short period of time. I bought a 3 pack and 1 was a out of box failure, it was replaced very quickly . My biggest complaint is after cleaning, baiting and resetting the trap I will get a flashing red light as if it was triggered when there is nothing in it, and trust me if a rat stepped on the metal contact plate if it is working correctly there would be no escape. Ive stuck my hand in a working one and it lights you up, no rat could survive that.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Had it two months and have caught a thing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and of course no booklet on tips, what to actually use in it etc. Of course the current works in it but I believe I have had this two months and have not caught anything. My sticky traps caught two rats after I bought this. Now that I have everything sealed I have seen a mouse or droppings. I guess if you are over ran with a rat problem then it might work. If you get one do a little research on what to put in it, the amount, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Tisby

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: Works as claimed. Humane and effective method. Follow directions and use dog food as bait while not leaving food out in dog's bowl. I avoid touching interior and food with bare hands to decrease chance of avoidance by the critters. If using where it could get wet, you must prevent water/rain contact with device, especially battery compartment. Also, if you have a small dog that could put its face into it going for the bait, you will want to position it where full access isn't possible. It is very heavy, sturdy, so turned toward a wall can work, for example, where only a small rodent opening exists.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Gosh dang it this thing kills rats
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best purchase I have made on Amazon. I lived in a house with 6 other guys, and about 60 rats. Neither the rat traps nor the exterminator helped much, but when the sticky traps did work, we would have to put the stuck, alive rat in a trash bag and take a sledgehammer to the poor animal. But after purchasing the Zapper, we were getting kills left and right. About 2 or 3 a day, and we were always home to hear the zap, so we could easily slide the dead rat into the trash without problem. I think this is by far the most humane way of killing, and we never had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Rat Zapper Ultra Rodent Trap a few months ago. I am happy to report that it has trapped and killed many chipmunks on my property. It is so easy too. I just put some sunflower seeds in the back of the trap, sit it next to a chipmunk hole, and turn it on. I set the trap at night, and in the morning there is a dead chipmunk in it. Clean up is easy too. I just put my gloves on, turn the trap off, and walk to the trash and tilt the trap, and out goes the chipmunk. This is so easy and really works. So worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Stewart-Bruewer

customer_reviews.title: I worked good for a short while
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a while and I killed about 6 big rats, then the pad in the center wanted to short out and you get a fault. I clean it and get it working again for maybe 1 day and then it malfunctions again!!! The circuitry is good, but you can't keep it from shorting out no matter how you clean it. You can't dis-assemble it to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: william 111

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: The first time I place the trap the bait was gone the light that indicates a kill was flashing but no rat or mice, then I figured maybe it takes a couple of times, then again I place a small pice of apple cover with peanut batter, since first time it was just peanut butter but same thing, the food is gone the light is flashing but no kill, I moved to a different spot maybe I though changing the location it will help, but no kill yet is been almost a week with same negative repetitive results... the rats outsmarted the trap... sad... because I was really hoping for this to work!!!😫
customer_reviews.author: Sarai Lunar

customer_reviews.title: Good-bye Chipmunks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this since we are inundated with a large amount of chipmunks!!! Read the reviews and thought we'd give it a try,....WELL, in the space of 4 hours, we have caught 4 chipmunks and 1 squirrel. Would highly recommend this for anyone looking to rid their yard of these unwelcome pests. Cute a chipmunks are, the thousands of holes in my yard are a walking hazard. I definitely don't want them getting into my house! We even tried the bucket and water, caught 1 and 1 baby possum. Then it quit working, they would jump before they fell into bucket. Purchase this Rat Zapper, you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Lpchef

customer_reviews.title: Works on chipmunks, too!
customer_reviews.text: Somehow a chipmunk got in my house. I had ordered this to keep them from destroying my patio plants, but had not put it outside yet. I set the zapper outside the room it was cornered in, blocked off all but the entrance to the zapper and it worked perfectly. It makes a loud audible alarm when the zapping begins. No mess, no fuss, the fur remained on the animal and not in the unit. Definitely going to try this outside now that the adrenaline has subsided...
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Rats Don’t Have a Chance!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Zapper now for over 2 years and probably have over 30 rat kills. This eliminates the use of poison which can then be distributed to other wildlife. The Zapper is very easy to use and clean as advertised. A red light will flash when it has caught a prize. I get about 8 kills on a set of batteries where it appears the zap is not terminal after this time. Recommend for ease of use without the use of poison.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Gimick
customer_reviews.text: Over two weeks and no rats killed. They actually love to leave their droppings all around the opening to torment me. I have tried nuts, peanut butter and good old cheese without zapping a single rat. I have much more luck with a cheap rat trap. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: William H

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: My rats must be smarter than all the other rats in the success review stories I have read. I put a load of peanut butter in the bait location and no rat ate it. I then made a bait "path" of peanut butter up to the first electrode and the rats licked it off but left the peanut butter at the bait station. This happened multiple times and its not just one rat either, I've seen at least a half dozen in the location of the Rat Zapper. I have to assume the rats can sense something that keeps them from going to the bait location.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F Leask

customer_reviews.title: Works for rats - not chipmunks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on a review which indicated it would take care of chipmunks. These “varmits” dig holes in my garden, flower pots and lawn to bury peanuts. Our neighbor provides these treats for the squirrels along with birdseed which is never raked up. The chipmunks think our well kept yard is for them. So far, chipmunks 0. They are so small - they can go inside the zapper, bring out the peanut butter water bottle cap and dine al fresco! Yet, what the zapper is intended for seems to work. It killed two rats!
customer_reviews.author: mountainhappy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely unhappy with this. We put in fresh new batteries and put in bait. Guess what. The rat got the bait and escaped. Yes it turned the light to red 3 separate times and all three times the rat got away. So basically this was another waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Silent but deadly
customer_reviews.text: It kills the mice. Would give 5 stars if it called them in. You need to use the right bait to attract them inside. Keep trying different food until you find what they like. I tried cheese, peanut butter, and finally cat food before it worked. Could have just been that they did not come around when I used the first two baits. Who knows? I like the fact that I do not have to touch them, just dump them out.
customer_reviews.author: Jack  Z.

customer_reviews.title: The target has been eliminated
customer_reviews.text: Works good on normal to large packrats, however small packrats seem to be able to slip in and out, all the while stealing my bait. Best bait result so far, the snack that smiles back, goldfish. You read it with the music, didn't you? :)
customer_reviews.author: Kratos

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE RAT TRAP and no customer service
customer_reviews.text: Defective, this rat trap does not work. I called support and they were suppose to send me a new one last week and I have not received it. I called again today and have been on hold for an hour and then disconnected. They also said I did not have to return the defective rat trap. So I'm out $53+ and rats running rampant. Waste of my time and money. DO NOT BUY, BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite good enough for squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the backyard. Does great for chipmunks, but maybe not quite strong enough (and barely big enough) for squirrels...more got shocked and got away than got killed. Batteries seem to last a long time. Occasional false alarms if debris flies in there. Be careful not to let it get wet on top. I got lucky after it got left out when it rained... let it dry for 2-3 days and still worked, though a previous model short-circuited after getting wet. Cleaning it as per the instructions (letting it sit in 1/2 inch-deep water) doesn't cut it. Put on a cleaning glove, get some damp paper towels, and get your hand up in there!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked the First Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for my wife to use while I was out of town. We had a pack rat living behind the washer/dryer area. The zapper was easy to set up, bait, and worked like a charm the very first time. Pretty easy clean up too. We had tried a handful of other traps, poison, glue, etc. but the rodent was too big. I would highly recommend this product, especially if your rodents are larger than a mouse. Safe to use around kids that are 6+ in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Gilded Pepper

customer_reviews.title: It Doesn't Work anymore...
customer_reviews.text: Got it today and set it right away with popcorn as bait. Brand new batteries and saw a mouse go in and took out the popcorn. I had 2 Original Rat Zapper and it worked beautifully. This new one is a joke. Will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: Billy C

customer_reviews.title: Super Killer
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an older battery operated one I purchased from a box store. I wore the old one out. With this one I killed 4 rats in a week. Had it along the inside of my garage wall. I used a dog treat as bait. I have kept it loaded and ready for months now. They stopped coming in my garage. I love the light. It blinks brightly telling you there is a kill. I am amazed at the size it will kill. Check out the picture. He still has the dog treat in his mouth! I don't do blood and guts. This thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: 4paws4keeps

customer_reviews.title: Would have been 5 stars if it would have worked!
customer_reviews.text: Received zapper worked great for two kills....so I ordered more...each one died (followed manufacturers instructions) for cleaning, replaced batteries. Still not working. My other one died after three kills. They were used indoors and manufacturers instructions to the t.
customer_reviews.author: Kawika

customer_reviews.title: it worked!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the zapper all set up in my garage for several months. this morning I saw the light was red so I tipped it over the trash can and something weighing what a rat would weigh fell out. I did not have to even look at it as it slide into the trash can. Success!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Finally put it to use after staying in storage since buying. Put in brand new batteries. Each morning I see blinking red light but no kills. Reset zapper (off/on plus checked bait) and waited. After 4th day, zapper stopped working completely with zero kills. I made sure I put damp cloth (also tried damp sponge) at entrance, but zero kills. Wasted money. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Bought several of these years ago and just bought several more recently
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these years ago and just bought several more recently. Not sure if quality has diminished or if they are not as battery friendly now. Bought 3 different brands of batteries and no luck. Suggested batteries by Rat Zapper are no longer in production, or at least I can't find them.
customer_reviews.author: Nighthunter

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY...Will break within short period
customer_reviews.text: I bought Zapper and it killed a few rodents and then after a few days it would signal catch and bait would be gone but no rodent. Changed batteries and same thing would happen so I called Zapper and they sent me new zapper. It worked for a few days and same thing. Called them back and they told me their policy was to give you one free zapper so too bad if you had another bad zapper. They were very abrasive and uninterested in helping solve the problem or care that they have faulty products. I went with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy O

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: Due to a severe winter in Central Oregon this year we have been overrun with packrats this spring/summer. Our patio potted plants and flower beds have taken a beating because of these little and not so little critters. I tried conventional traps and poison to no avail. Based on the other positive reviews I bought this device in hopes it would work. Arrived yesterday and overnight caught my first packrat. Worked like a charm. Easy clean up this morning. I would highly recommend. The rodent I caught was quite large but the trap worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked The First Time!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried just about every method to get rid of bothersome rats from the canyon nearby. They were making a home under the hood of my car. I tried sonic repulsion, traditional traps, sticky pads, poison bait stations, repellant sprays. I had varying degrees of success. I tried the Rat Zapper. So easy and it worked the first time I turned it on. I placed it where there was evidence of droppings and the next morning the rat had been 'zapped' .
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J Tellez

customer_reviews.title: Works almost too well
customer_reviews.text: The Rat Zapper works VERY well, almost too well. In fact, aside from the 2 mice and 3 rats (what i'm targeting), I've caught 6 cockroaches, 3 slugs, several other bugs, 1 squirrel (poor thing), and zapped 3 raccoons and 2 opossums that tried to reach into it (which doesn't hurt them, but really pisses them off). The metal plates in there are very sensitive (as evidence of the dead bugs) and rely on the vermin making contact between them, thus completing the electric circuit. Think of this as a powerful stun gun so it's very quick and very humane. Just make sure the unit is OFF before you try to clean it, yea, that was a fun lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Got a mouse, but I was hunting RATS
customer_reviews.text: I know there were some rats in the attic so I placed this where the small sticky rat traps had failed. Two days with dog food bait, and then maybe 2 days of peanut butter bait with dog food but no luck. Then I placed it outside under the shade along the wall and the next morning there was a dead mouse. Not a rat that I am still hunting but another dead mouse is ok too. Will re position and see if this thing will kill a rat as promised. So far, the Victor RAT trap (larger spring loaded version) has been more successful.
customer_reviews.author: Minty

customer_reviews.title: Rat Zappers life span too short.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three Rat Zappers. I was impressed with their performance. Too good to be true. After a few months one by one they stopped working. Changed batteries, cleaned the floor of trap and still only a red blinking light. I also found that after killing one rat the others avoided the trap entirely. Killing mice when working was excellant. Rats not so much. I think a trap door in the back that opens to set bait with a compartment to use peanut butter would eliminate the peanut oils from getting in contact with the metal plates.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Jane Evans

customer_reviews.title: worked well until it stopped
customer_reviews.text: it worked well when it worked. I had it for maybe a week or two before it just stopped working? I had it in a barn outside, but covered from the elements. It did drain batteries VERY quickly which is a shame, its so expensive and then to keep putting D batteries in there over and over! I think it zapped 3 mice before it was too weak and then I had to replace the batteries. It zapped a few chipmunks too but then just died. I loved the concept of this zapper and was really hoping to have it for a while. I think i may just need to get a barn cat :/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This was a new trap - I bought it some months ago, so can't return it to Amazon, but I didn't use it; just installed 4 new D batteries that have a good charge - I tested them --- and the red light flashes as though it had caught something.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyR

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I placed it in the garage. After the first night the light was blinking and there was a dead mouse. I dumped the mouse and placed it back in the same spot. The next morning the light was blinking, the bait was gone, but there was no mouse. I baited it again. The next morning there was a blinking light, no bait and again no mouse. I repeated these steps and again had the same outcome. I am not impressed. With the amount of money this costs there should not be a mouse that is able to go into this trap get the bait and make it out alive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian  Smith

customer_reviews.title: Zap the rats before they zap your car wiring!
customer_reviews.text: Dang this thing works. After pack rats did $2000 damage to my family car (they dine on electrical wiring), I declared 2015 to be the Year of the Rat Apocalypse. I quickly zapped a dozen of the wretches within a couple weeks using two of these (a lower end model and this one--they work equally well). Things tapered off, but a few weeks later I just got two more of the next generation. For best results, I place them at dusk with dog kibbles scattered inside and a dozen or so scattered around the entranced, placed near areas of obvious activity, near cover.
customer_reviews.author: Gary McCaleb

customer_reviews.title: which made me sad. After that
customer_reviews.text: I had it outside, but off the ground in a completely sheltered location. First day, I caught a squirrel, which made me sad. After that, it never caught a rat. The bait would turn up missing, and the light would blink, but no rat. Sometimes the light would blink for no good reason. I even put a sticky trap on the sides of it, inside. Fur on the sticky, tripped light, no rat.
customer_reviews.author: BookTootsie

customer_reviews.title: I ordered 8 of these traps and none of them ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 8 of these traps and none of them worked as noted on the instruction. 8 units were returned. After installing the batteries, and turning on the device, the red light should blink once but this never happened. There was no way to determine if the units worked properly, but all 8 failed. This "Ultra" model appears to have a cheaper design than the previous model, of which I have 6 units. The older models have a green light indicator indicating that all is operationally ready as well as a red light indicator for other conditions. I called the manufacturer/distributor, Victor, to inform them of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not really satisfied yet.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this product for about week. We bought the 4 pack. Only caught 2 smaller mice. Full grown rat went right in one. It grabbed the bait and got a zap that scared it but it backed out and took off. So far this is not looking promising for this product. We had to replace the batteries already on the 2 that actually caught a mouse. Not really satisfied yet. UPDATE* today all the traps have now been set off ... bait eaten and nothing in them. Will not waste my money again and do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Buffi

customer_reviews.title: Worth EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.text: Worth EVERY PENNY! We have a cat that brings in rats, through the dog door, as toys! They are almost always alive and then he tires of them and we have a rat in the house! This little device is amazing. Works quickly and the best part is there is no mess! Just dump it out and go on about your day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great. The only thing that took the longest was to get the rat in the trap but it did the job. I am satisfied with the results. You don’t even have to touch the contents of the trap as you can just dump it into a bag. Check frequently for spiders that set up their webs inside because it will detect it like the trap has another occupant. I recommend cleaning after each kill as rats won’t enter at the smell of death from the former occupant. To be safe, remove batteries prior to cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Smith

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say how great this works! Saved our patio from getting torn up. Very easy! VERY CLEAN. I Actually was getting annoyed with how many times I had to empty it. The only issue is, we used this outside and because it cannot get wet, we had a hard time planning on putting it out, leaving not many options to catch anything.
customer_reviews.author: fabmom

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We live in a rural area and have a multitude of field mice coming into our garage. We had tried 3 different types of mouse traps and none of them worked. A friend recommended this product and said she had great results with it catching rats and mice. I set this up in our garage and caught 34 mice within 3 weeks! And, didn't change the batteries once! I used peanut butter on a cracker as bait. I put 'fresh' bait in after each kill. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: SB in Greenacres

customer_reviews.title: Zap the rats and mice
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my Costume garage. Some little varmits were eating parts of my fur Mascots. Another person, who writes a union paper, for a company my husband retired from, had commented in this paper about this amazing product. I still had the article in my file, so bought one. I have food and batteries in the unit but also had an army load of rat killer in there before I bought this. I haven't caught one yet; but if they sneak in, when I'm not looking, and the storage barn door is open, I'm ready. I checked the unit when I was there last and the batteries are working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sally J Orlow

customer_reviews.title: It broke after one month of use
customer_reviews.text: I have had other Rat Zapper's that lasted for over a year and this one broke right after I was able to return it. The lights do not go on and it makes a really nice place to feed rats and mice (they love it since they no longer get shocked).
customer_reviews.author: ALAN M.

customer_reviews.title: This is not like previous models with an ON/OFF switch
customer_reviews.text: Beware! This is not like previous models with an ON/OFF switch. now the switch is labeled "0" and "1". No translation is provided. It shipped in the 1 position, which, if it is like the previous model, would be the On position -- not the position I would want it in when inserting batteries. The phone number on the package is not in service.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

product_meta.title: Rat Zapper Ultra RZU001-4 Indoor Electronic Rat Trap - 1 Trap
product_meta.description: Size:1 TrapThe Rat Zapper Ultra Rodent Trap offers you more kills and longer stand by times. This trap is perfect for larger rats (and mice too), ongoing rodent infestations and commercial applications. The kill chamber is larger than the Rat Zapper Classic. Bait with ordinary pet food or another high-protein bait (peanut butter,etc.). Mice and rats enter the chamber and are dispatched with a powerful jolt of electricity. If they'll fit in the chamber, the Rat Zapper will dispatch them. No blood, no gore, no mess and no poisons to endanger your pets or the environment. Flashing kill light tells you when you have a catch; simply tip the Rat Zapper and let the dead rodent slide out. Dimensions: Approximately 4 in x 4.75 in x 11.5 in. Approximately 60 kills with one set of 4 alkaline "D" cell batteries (not included). Easy to use and reusable.
feature_bullets: Ideal for catching and killing larger rats
Easy to use - insert batteries, bait, place, turn it on, and relax, One set of 4 "D" batteries = 60 kills
Hands-free no touch, no view disposal reduces the yuck factor
Note: This product is for indoor use only.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars1,517 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
